body.p:
Louisville, Ky. Sept 9th 1863
To His Excellency the Hon. Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Excellency, will permit me Respectfully to Solicit your clemency on behalf of your humble petitioners mentioned. On the documents presented to you by Joseph Henin. I know that he has acted in this case, as well as his Security Mr. Chas Dupuy, with disinterestidness, and, if one or the other were obliged to pay the fine mentioned, they would be reduced to misfortune. I respectfully solicit in their favor And Hope that your Excellency will take the case of the applicant into full consideration.

Very Respectfully:
Your most & obed servant
J.J. Perrin
Asst Vice Consul of France
